app.name: MiMind
app.boundary: This product is a mental wellness coaching tool, not a medical product. It does not provide clinical diagnosis, medication advice, or prescriptions.
app.crisis_note: If you are in immediate danger, please contact local emergency services.

landing.hero_subtitle: Professional mental wellness coaching platform to support your personal growth
landing.feature_scales_desc: PHQ-9, GAD-7 and other professional mental health screening scales
landing.feature_tests_desc: MBTI, Big Five, Attachment Style and more interactive tests to discover yourself
landing.feature_coach_desc: AI mental wellness coach with multiple counseling styles for professional support
landing.feature_tools_desc: White noise, breathing exercises, guided meditation for stress relief

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: How we collect, use, and protect your information

sections.heading: 1. Information We Collect
sections.body: We collect account details, assessment responses, conversation data, and usage logs that you provide for service delivery and safety triage.

sections.heading: 2. How We Use Information
sections.body: Your data is used for account management, assessment scoring, risk detection, entitlement control, and service improvement.

sections.heading: 3. Data Security and Retention
sections.body: We apply encrypted transport and storage, strict internal access controls, and retention/deletion practices aligned with compliance requirements.

sections.heading: 4. Your Rights
sections.body: You may request data export or deletion. This product is a mental wellness coaching tool and does not provide medical diagnosis or prescriptions.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: Please review these terms before using MiMind

sections.heading: 1. Nature of Service
sections.body: MiMind is a mental wellness coaching platform, not a medical service, and does not provide diagnosis, treatment, or medication advice.

sections.heading: 2. User Responsibilities
sections.body: You agree to provide accurate information, use the platform lawfully, and not bypass safety protections.

sections.heading: 3. Risk and Emergency Support
sections.body: If there is self-harm, harm-to-others, or any immediate danger, contact local emergency or professional services immediately.

sections.heading: 4. Updates to Terms
sections.body: We may update these terms for product and compliance reasons. Continued use indicates acceptance of the latest version.

home.reassessment_overdue_body: {{scales}} are overdue by {{days}} days. Please retake soon to refresh your assessment.
home.reassessment_upcoming_body: {{scales}} are due in {{days}} days. Consider retaking early.
home.channel_yellow: Some features are limited Â· professional support is recommended
home.channel_red: Please prioritize professional mental health support
home.channel_yellow_hint: AI Coach is currently unavailable, while other features remain available.
home.channel_red_hint: Please seek professional mental health support immediately.

auth.agree_policy: I have read and agree to the
auth.session_invalid: Session is invalid, please log in again
auth.reset_email_sent: If this email is registered, we have sent a reset link.

onboarding.title: Complete Your Initial Screening
onboarding.subtitle: Please finish the baseline scales first so we can assign your triage channel.
onboarding.note: Includes PHQ-9 / GAD-7 baseline screening and required risk items for safe triage.
onboarding.submit_success: Assessment completed. Your triage channel is now available.

errors.incomplete: Please answer the current question before continuing.
errors.no_channel: Unable to get triage result. Please retry.

scales.title: Assessment Center
scales.subtitle: Understand your mental health with professional scales
scales.resume_hint: SCL-90 progress is saved automatically on this device.
scales.paywall_subtitle: Your current plan includes submissions only. Subscribe to view full score interpretation and insights.
scales.professional_library_subtitle: Evidence-based scale references with citation, use-case, scoring logic, and boundary notes.

intro.phq9: PHQ-9 is aligned with DSM depressive symptom criteria and screens symptom severity over the past two weeks.
intro.gad7: GAD-7 is a widely validated anxiety screener for estimating anxiety severity in the past two weeks.
intro.pss10: PSS-10 measures perceived stress appraisal and is commonly used in stress research.
intro.cssrs: C-SSRS uses structured risk items to identify recent self-harm or suicidal ideation and behavior risk.
intro.scl90: SCL-90 spans multiple symptom domains and supports broad screening of overall psychological distress.
intro.who5: WHO-5 tracks positive well-being in the last two weeks and is useful for observing emotional recovery trend.
intro.generic: This scale follows standardized psychometric design for preliminary status screening.

errors.complete_section: Please finish all questions in this section before continuing.

tests.title: Interactive Tests
tests.subtitle: Discover more about yourself
tests.pair_invite_subtitle: Share this link with a friend. Once they complete the same test, a pairing report is generated.
tests.pair_pending: Waiting for your partner to finish the test.

intro.mbti: Based on Jungian type dimensions, this test profiles information and decision-making preferences.
intro.16p: Extends MBTI-like dimensions with an identity axis to describe personality style variation.
intro.big5: Grounded in the Five-Factor Model (OCEAN), one of the strongest evidence-based personality frameworks.
intro.attachment: Based on attachment theory, this test explores security needs and relational interaction patterns.
intro.love_language: Uses the five love languages framework to capture preferred ways of giving and receiving care.
intro.stress_coping: Based on the Lazarus-Folkman coping model, this test assesses common coping strategy tendencies.
intro.eq: Informed by emotional intelligence models, it evaluates awareness, regulation, empathy, and relationship skills.
intro.inner_child: Draws on trauma-informed inner-child frameworks to reflect emotional and protective response patterns.
intro.boundary: Uses interpersonal boundary-setting theory to assess boundary clarity and consistency in relationships.
intro.psych_age: Combines developmental and trait indicators to estimate psychological age-band tendencies.
intro.generic: This test is theory-informed and intended for non-clinical self-exploration.

share_card.footer_line1: Share your profile, grow with clarity

coach_gate.title: Complete a quick assessment before starting AI Coach
coach_gate.missing_desc: To provide you with safe and personalized support, we need to understand your current state. The following scales take just a few minutes.
coach_gate.expired_desc: Your last assessment was over 30 days ago. Please update your baseline data to ensure AI Coach safety.
coach_gate.scale_phq9_desc: Quick check on your mood over the past two weeks
coach_gate.scale_gad7_desc: Assess your anxiety level over the past two weeks
coach_gate.scale_cssrs_desc: Required safety triage items to ensure your wellbeing
coach_gate.scale_pss10_desc: Understand your recent stress level for better coaching

coach.title: AI Mental Coach
coach.subtitle: Choose a counseling style you prefer and start today's conversation
coach.disclaimer: For coaching purposes only. Does not provide diagnosis, medication advice, or guarantee confidentiality.
coach.style_warm_desc: Empathetic listening to help you feel understood and accepted
coach.style_rational_desc: Structured thinking to help you clarify problems and create action plans
coach.style_deep_desc: Explore deep inner patterns and understand subconscious influences
coach.style_mindful_desc: Learn present-moment awareness with non-judgmental observation
coach.style_action_desc: Goal-oriented with quick action and executable plans
coach.history_subtitle: Review summaries from your previous coaching conversations
coach.history_empty: No past sessions yet. Complete a coaching session and it will appear here.
coach.restricted: Based on your current assessment, the AI Coach is temporarily unavailable. We recommend consulting a mental health professional.
coach.safety_pause: A potential safety concern has been detected. The conversation has been paused. Please review the resources below.

tools.meditation_track_calm_desc: Release neck and shoulder tension with a gentle breathing reset.
tools.meditation_track_focus_desc: Bring attention back to body sensations and reduce mental noise.

tools.meditation_track_sleep_starlight_desc: Slow down mental chatter and prepare for deeper rest.
tools.meditation_track_focus_pulse_desc: Steady rhythm for single-task focus sessions.
tools.meditation_track_recovery_forest_desc: Nature-forward track for emotional and sensory reset.
tools.meditation_track_focus_deep_desc: Longer cycle to return attention and reduce inner noise.
tools.meditation_track_recovery_mantra_desc: Gentle mantra texture for grounding after overwhelm.
tools.meditation_track_stress_drone_desc: Low-intensity sound bed for quick regulation.
tools.meditation_track_sleep_night_desc: Warm relaxing layer for bedtime wind-down.

rescue.title: Relief Hub
rescue.subtitle: When everything feels too much, pause here first. Use the fastest stabilization tools and return to a tolerable rhythm.
rescue.minimal_hint: Do one thing first. Lower stimulation and guide your body back to safety.
rescue.quick_sensory_desc: Reduce overload and rebuild a sense of safety quickly.
rescue.quick_breath_desc: Follow the breathing cadence to downshift your nervous system.

mindfulness.title: Mindfulness Space
mindfulness.subtitle: Practice slower, deeper regulation here. Meditation and manifestation tools will keep expanding in this space.
mindfulness.meditation_desc: Pick a guided track and follow breath plus attention to settle deeply.
mindfulness.quick_desc: When you only need to stabilize, use a 1-3 minute micro-practice to regain tolerable rhythm.
mindfulness.deep_desc: When capacity allows, move into full-length practice for longer-term regulation.
mindfulness.meditation_deep_desc: Choose a longer session and complete a full breath-awareness-closure cycle.
mindfulness.manifestation_quick_desc: Generate one focused affirmation and pull attention back to your intention.
mindfulness.flow_step_1: Stabilize first with a quick practice (breath or one affirmation)
mindfulness.flow_step_2: Then move into deep practice (meditation or manifestation cards)
mindfulness.flow_step_3: Close with one actionable micro-step for today

manifestation.title: Manifestation
manifestation.subtitle: Turn intention into written and visual anchors you can revisit daily.
manifestation.desc: Capture affirmations and vision cards to reinforce positive momentum.
manifestation.affirmation_desc: Write one sentence you want to reinforce now.
manifestation.affirmation_placeholder: e.g. I am becoming steadier, clearer, and more grounded.
manifestation.empty_affirmation: No entries yet. Add your first affirmation.
manifestation.vision_desc: Turn your desired future into cards you can read and feel.
manifestation.vision_note_placeholder: Describe what you see and feel when this vision has happened.
manifestation.empty_vision: No vision cards yet. Save your first one.
manifestation.quick_desc: Pick a focus, generate an affirmation, and save it in one step.
manifestation.quick_template_stability: I am returning to steadiness and clarity, and I can finish this next small step.
manifestation.quick_template_confidence: I deserve to be seen, and I can express and move my top priority forward today.
manifestation.quick_template_calm: I allow myself to slow down, and my breath brings me back to calm control.
manifestation.deep_desc: Turn intention into actionable cues through affirmations and vision cards.

meditation_attr.pixabay_no_attribution: No attribution required. Keep source URL and license snapshots before release.
meditation_attr.mixkit_no_attribution: Attribution is typically not required; verify the latest Mixkit terms before publishing.
meditation_attr.incompetech_credit_note: If track-level credit is required, mirror attribution in-app and in publishing channels.
meditation_attr.incompetech_retail_note: If using no-attribution retail licenses, retain purchase receipts and license proof.

stress_calm_reset_10.title: Calm Reset (10 min)
stress_calm_reset_10.desc: A short decompression session when your body feels over-tightened by task load.

stress_soft_reset_8.title: Soft Nervous Reset (8 min)
stress_soft_reset_8.desc: A quick between-meetings reset that stabilizes you without breaking momentum.

stress_evening_release_12.title: Evening Unload (12 min)
stress_evening_release_12.desc: A transition from work mode into rest by releasing accumulated cognitive strain.

focus_grounding_15.title: Focus Grounding (15 min)
focus_grounding_15.desc: Brings attention back from noise to the task you want to execute now.

focus_deepwork_12.title: Deep Work Ramp-Up (12 min)
focus_deepwork_12.desc: Use before a 25-50 minute focus block to warm up executive control.

focus_breath_align_9.title: Breath Alignment (9 min)
focus_breath_align_9.desc: Builds stable breathing cadence before writing, study, or coding sessions.

sleep_winddown_20.title: Sleep Wind Down (20 min)
sleep_winddown_20.desc: Downshifts arousal levels and helps your system enter sleep-ready mode.

sleep_bodyscan_15.title: Body Scan for Sleep (15 min)
sleep_bodyscan_15.desc: Progressive release from toes to head to reduce bedtime hyper-alertness.

sleep_night_rain_20.title: Night Rain Drift (20 min)
sleep_night_rain_20.desc: Steady ambience helps the mind move from rumination to calmer drift.

recovery_somatic_10.title: Somatic Recovery (10 min)
recovery_somatic_10.desc: Reconnect with body cues after emotional spikes to regain stability.

recovery_clarity_11.title: Clarity Recovery (11 min)
recovery_clarity_11.desc: Restores mental clarity and willingness to re-engage with meaningful tasks.

recovery_gentle_14.title: Gentle Rebound (14 min)
recovery_gentle_14.desc: A gentle close-out after high-pressure days to avoid further depletion.

sensory.title: Sensory Overload Kit
sensory.subtitle: When the world feels too much, this is your safe space. Take it at your own pace.
sensory.grounding_desc: Shift your attention from inner discomfort to your senses, returning to the present moment.
sensory.ground_see_hint: Look around â€” notice colors, shapes, and light
sensory.ground_touch_hint: Feel the textures â€” clothes, desk, air
sensory.ground_hear_hint: Distant sounds, wind, even your own breathing
sensory.ground_smell_hint: Any scent in the air â€” food, flowers, dust
sensory.ground_taste_hint: A lingering taste, or take a sip of water
sensory.disclaimer: This tool is for self-regulation only and cannot replace professional help. If you feel severely distressed, please contact a professional.

pomo.no_tasks: No tasks yet â€” break one down

neuro.title: Cognitive Trait Exploration
neuro.subtitle: Discover your brain's default settings
neuro.intro: These assessments help you explore cognitive traits like attention patterns, social style, and sensory sensitivity. All results are for self-understanding only â€” not medical diagnoses.
neuro.share_subtitle: Pick a platform ratio and generate your neurodiversity profile card.
neuro.what_is_body: Neurodiversity recognizes that every brain operates uniquely. Differences in attention, social intuition, and sensory sensitivity are part of natural human variation â€” not deficits. Understanding your traits helps you work, socialize, and care for yourself more effectively.
neuro.asrs_desc: Explore your attention, task management, and activity patterns (based on ASRS v1.1)
neuro.asrs_summary_low: Your attention and executive patterns fall within the typical range. Everyone gets distracted or procrastinates sometimes â€” that's completely normal.
neuro.asrs_summary_moderate: You show some notable traits in attention or activity levels. You might benefit from techniques like time-blocking or environment management. This isn't a problem â€” your brain simply has its own rhythm.
neuro.asrs_summary_high: Your attention and executive patterns show significant traits that may create challenges in daily task management. Consider using timers, task breakdown tools, and consult a professional for additional support strategies.
neuro.aq10_desc: Understand your social intuition, detail focus, and systematic thinking (based on AQ-10)
neuro.aq10_summary_low: Your social and information processing style falls within the typical range. Your perception of social cues and multitasking ability are well-balanced.
neuro.aq10_summary_moderate: You show some unique traits in social or information processing dimensions. You may prefer deep focus over shallow socializing, or have heightened detail awareness. This is a cognitive strength.
neuro.aq10_summary_high: Your information processing style shows significant systematic or deep-focus traits. You may excel at logical analysis and pattern recognition but need more energy for quick social switching. Explore social strategies that fit your style.
neuro.hsp_desc: Explore your sensory sensitivity, emotional depth, and processing style (based on HSP Scale)
neuro.hsp_summary_low: Your sensitivity level is in the typical range. External stimuli have relatively little impact on you, and you likely handle busy environments with ease.
neuro.hsp_summary_moderate: You show moderate highly sensitive traits. You're likely responsive to environmental changes and have a rich inner life. Learning to recognize overstimulation signals and taking timely breaks will help.
neuro.hsp_summary_high: You are a highly sensitive person. You likely perceive sounds, lights, and emotional atmospheres more intensely. This is an innate temperament shared by 15-20% of the population. Use the Sensory Relief Kit and intentional alone time to protect your energy.
neuro.catq_desc: Understand how much strategy and energy you use to adapt your social presentation (based on CAT-Q)
neuro.catq_summary_low: Your profile suggests that in most situations you can present yourself naturally without sustained social masking. Overall social energy cost appears manageable.
neuro.catq_summary_moderate: You often adapt your expression style to keep interactions smooth. This can be an effective social strategy, but it may also consume extra energy. Plan recovery windows after high-intensity social settings.
neuro.catq_summary_high: Your results indicate a high level of social camouflage effort (masking, compensation, and assimilation). This does not mean something is wrong with you. It suggests you may be carrying a high social regulation load over time. Prioritize lower-burden relationships, reduce back-to-back social blocks, and protect regular recovery time.

nd_disclaimer.title: Important: This Is Not a Clinical Diagnosis
nd_disclaimer.legal_review_badge: Legal Review Placeholder: Pending Counsel Sign-Off
nd_disclaimer.legal_review_note: Final compliance wording must be approved by legal counsel before release (placeholder marker).
nd_disclaimer.p1: This test is adapted from psychological scales and is designed to help you explore your cognitive and behavioral traits â€” your brain's "default settings."
nd_disclaimer.p2: MiMind is not a medical institution. Test results must NOT be used as a clinical diagnosis for ADHD, Autism Spectrum, or any other neurodevelopmental condition.
nd_disclaimer.p3: Results are for self-understanding only and do not represent any medical conclusion.
nd_disclaimer.seek_help: If you feel these traits significantly impact your work, studies, or relationships, we recommend seeking evaluation from a qualified psychiatrist.
nd_disclaimer.banner_title: Trait Exploration â€” Not a Clinical Diagnosis
nd_disclaimer.banner_body: These results help you understand your cognitive and behavioral patterns. They cannot replace professional evaluation. Consult a psychiatrist for further guidance.
nd_disclaimer.coach_message: ðŸ’¡ Heads up: The following discussion involves neurodiversity-related traits. MiMind assessments and conversations are designed to help you explore your cognitive and behavioral patterns â€” they are NOT clinical diagnoses. If you feel these traits significantly impact your daily life, we recommend seeking evaluation from a qualified professional.

neuro_share.footer: Neurodiversity Trait Exploration Â· Not a Clinical Diagnosis
